intro: Asemanthia maingayi var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy asemanthia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
